title: The cost of a data breach
summary: The average cost of a data breach has surged to US$4.88 million in 2024, up from US$4.45 million in 2023 — a 10% increase and the highest rise since the Covid-19 pandemic, according to IBM’s Cost of a Data Breach 2024 report. This spike is attributed to higher costs of lost business, including operational downtime and customer attrition, as well as increased expenses for post-breach responses like staffing customer service help desks and paying higher regulatory fines.
content: This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 12, 2024 - August 18, 2024

title: Sowing seeds over the last 140 years to foster Penang’s progression
summary: HSBC's legacy in Malaysia traces back to 1884 when the Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited established its first office in the country on the island of Penang. The strategic location and port facilities of Penang were key factors in attracting banks like HSBC, whose role was focused on fostering trade, and meeting international customer demands.

title: Cocoa jumps most since            May on fears               of dry weather
summary: NEW YORK: Cocoa futures soared as much as 12% in New York, the biggest intraday jump in three months, as dry weather in the world’s top producers fuels concerns about output in the upcoming season.
content:
FILE PHOTO: Farmers work at a cocoa farm in Daloa, Ivory Coast Oct. 3, 2023. REUTERS/Ange Aboa/File Photo

NEW YORK: Cocoa futures soared as much as 12% in New York, the biggest intraday jump in three months, as dry weather in the world’s top producers fuels concerns about output in the upcoming season.

The most-active contract reached US$7,525 a tonne last Friday, on course for a weekly gain of more than 10%.

title: Shenzhen to issue new offshore bonds in Hong Kong
summary: HONG KONG: The Shenzhen municipal government in Guangdong province will issue offshore yuan-denominated bonds in Hong Kong for the fourth time since 2021, further bolstering Hong Kong-Shenzhen financial collaboration by encouraging more mainland governments and corporate issuers to tap Hong Kong’s fund-raising platform for channelling capital to promote regional development.
content:
Signage for Manulife Financial Corp. atop a building in Hong Kong, China, on Friday, Aug. 2, 2024. Hong Kong is seeing an influx of professionals from mainland China’s finance and tech sectors who are disillusioned with their career and salary prospects across the border. Many are trying to make a living and stay in the city by peddling insurance products, giving a boost to a once-sleepy industry. Photographer: Lam Yik/Bloomberg

summary: LABUAN: All recommendations and views highlighted by local industry players and non-governmental organisations (NGOs) will be carefully considered in the upcoming Budget 2025, Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Federal Territories) Dr Zaliha Mustafa said.She added that the government ...
content:
LABUAN: All recommendations and views highlighted by local industry players and non-governmental organisations (NGOs) will be carefully considered in the upcoming Budget 2025, Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Federal Territories) Dr Zaliha Mustafa said.

She added that the government remained committed to addressing concerns raised by stakeholders to enhance the wellbeing of the people and boost the island's economy.

title: GDP could be revised higher to 6.0 pct, according to analysts
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's gross domestic product (GDP) could be revised higher to at least 6.0 per cent, according to some analysts.CIMB Securities Sdn Bhd thinks that its 4.9 per cent forecast for the full year appears conservative now.The firm ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's gross domestic product (GDP) could be revised higher to at least 6.0 per cent, according to some analysts.

CIMB Securities Sdn Bhd thinks that its 4.9 per cent forecast for the full year appears conservative now.

The firm stated that the revised figure reflects a robust performance in the services and manufacturing sectors, marking the fastest growth since the third quarter of 2017 (3Q17), excluding the period affected by the Covid-19 pandemic.

"We believe this likely marks the peak yea

title: Decision to restart Malaysia-EU FTA talks imminent, says envoy
summary: Outgoing European Union (EU) Ambassador to Malaysia Michalis Rokas has expressed confidence that the decision to restart negotiations on the stalled Malaysia-EU Free Trade Agreement (MEUFTA) is imminent.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 11): Outgoing European Union (EU) Ambassador to Malaysia Michalis Rokas has expressed confidence that the decision to restart negotiations on the stalled Malaysia-EU Free Trade Agreement (MEUFTA) is imminent.

“Having started the stock-taking exercise last year, the decision to restart talks on MEUFTA may take, at the maximum, a couple of months,” said Rokas, who will take up his new posting in North Macedonia on Sept 1, 2024, after a four-year stint in Malaysia.

title: NY eco activists turn up heat on Citi over polluting investments
summary: NEW YORK: Environmental campaigners in New York have kept up a campaign of direct action against one of the city's foremost banking empires, Citi, accusing the group of fueling the climate crisis.Enraged by Citi's bankrolling of polluting ...
content:
NEW YORK: Environmental campaigners in New York have kept up a campaign of direct action against one of the city's foremost banking empires, Citi, accusing the group of fueling the climate crisis.

Enraged by Citi's bankrolling of polluting businesses, activists have unleashed a "summer of heat" campaign that includes protests and leafleting, coupled with an online pressure campaign.

Every week, dozens of protesters gather at Citigroup's gleaming headquarters in Lower Manhattan to demand it change its fossil

title: China's housing rental industry crucial to future real estate market: PBOC
summary: BEIJING, Aug 10 (Bernama-Xinhua) – The housing rental industry in China, anticipated to experience strong demand and stable supply, is identified as a "crucial direction" for the future development model of the country's real estate market, according to a statement by ...
content:
BEIJING, Aug 10 (Bernama-Xinhua) – The housing rental industry in China, anticipated to experience strong demand and stable supply, is identified as a "crucial direction" for the future development model of the country's real estate market, according to a statement by the People's Bank of China (PBOC) on Saturday, reported Xinhua.

Given the profound changes in the supply and demand dynamics of the real estate market, the scale of existing housing in China is already very large, the central bank noted in a report on mo

title: Risda's AET programme helps rubber smallholders boost income
summary: GUA MUSANG: Additional Economic Activities Programme (AET), provided by the Rubber Industry Smallholders Development Authority (Risda) under its entrepreneur development programme, has been very helpful in increasing the income of smallholders through business activities.A smallholder and owner of the ...
content:
GUA MUSANG: Additional Economic Activities Programme (AET), provided by the Rubber Industry Smallholders Development Authority (Risda) under its entrepreneur development programme, has been very helpful in increasing the income of smallholders through business activities.

A smallholder and owner of the business 'Mummy Jelita Empire,' Che Norbi Yaacob, 63, shared that she received RM10,000 under the AET scheme in 2011 to start a business in traditional delicacy, specifically 'akok' and 'bahulu'.

title: Hindenburg alleges India market regulator chief held stake in offshore funds used by Adani Group
summary: MUMBAI: US-based short-seller Hindenburg Research in a new report released on Saturday alleged that the chairperson of India's market regulator Madhabi Puri Buch previously held investments in certain offshore funds that were also used by Adani Group.In a ...
content:
MUMBAI: US-based short-seller Hindenburg Research in a new report released on Saturday alleged that the chairperson of India's market regulator Madhabi Puri Buch previously held investments in certain offshore funds that were also used by Adani Group.

In a late night press statement, Buch denied these allegations and called them baseless, adding that a detailed statement would be issued later.

Hindenburg's report sparked fresh criticism from India's opposition political parties who demanded a parliamentary

title: US inflation still 'uncomfortably' high: Fed official
summary: WASHINGTON: US inflation remains "uncomfortably" above the Federal Reserve's target despite the progress it has made in recent months, a senior bank official said Saturday.The US central bank has held interest rates at a two-decade high for the ...
content:
WASHINGTON: US inflation remains "uncomfortably" above the Federal Reserve's target despite the progress it has made in recent months, a senior bank official said Saturday.

The US central bank has held interest rates at a two-decade high for the past year as it battles to return inflation to its long-term target of two percent following a pandemic-era surge in prices. 

The Fed's favored inflation gauge now sits at an annual rate of just 2.5 percent – well below the peak reached in 2022 – while the US economy is

title: MIDF Research 'cautiously optimistic' about Hup Seng Industries, citing stable product demand
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: MIDF Research maintains a cautiously optimistic view on Hup Seng Industries Bhd's outlook for the financial year 2024 (FY24) on stable product demand and the growing preference among Malaysian consumers for local goods.It said that Hup Seng'...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: MIDF Research maintains a cautiously optimistic view on Hup Seng Industries Bhd's outlook for the financial year 2024 (FY24) on stable product demand and the growing preference among Malaysian consumers for local goods.

It said that Hup Seng's consistent dividend payouts and strong net cash position provide a solid buffer against potential downside risks, further reinforcing the positive outlook.

However, the firm has adjusted its rating on the company from 'buy' to 'neutral,' d

title: Sunway REIT may challenge competitors in Kluang's saturated retail market, according to Kenanga Research
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Sunway Real Estate Investment Trust (Sunway REIT) is expected to challenge its competitors in the fairly saturated market with its RM158 million acquisition of Kluang Mall by enhancing the tenant mix and improving the shopping experience.As a ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sunway Real Estate Investment Trust (Sunway REIT) is expected to challenge its competitors in the fairly saturated market with its RM158 million acquisition of Kluang Mall by enhancing the tenant mix and improving the shopping experience.

As a result, Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd (Kenanga Research) has raised its earnings forecast for the financial year 2025 (FY25) by 2 per cent and increased its target price to RM1.69 from RM1.65.

The firm noted that the retail mall market in Kluang is quite saturated, with

title: Courtyard by Marriott Subang to open in 2026
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: SKS Group and Marriott International have signed a hotel management agreement to launch Courtyard by Marriott Subang in Selangor. This marks SKS' third collaboration with Marriott International and its first venture outside Johor, following the successful debut of ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: SKS Group and Marriott International have signed a hotel management agreement to launch Courtyard by Marriott Subang in Selangor.

This marks SKS' third collaboration with Marriott International and its first venture outside Johor, following the successful debut of Four Points by Sheraton Desaru in 2021 and the upcoming opening of Sheraton Johor Bahru next year.

Courtyard by Marriott Subang, scheduled to open in 2026, will be part of a mixed-use development that includes retail spaces.

The hotel

title: Positive outlook for property sector: MIDF Research
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: MIDF Research expects a positive outlook for the property sector, citing strong underlying demand.In a recent note, the firm said that property developers are likely to see earnings growth in the upcoming second quarter of 2024 (2QCY24)."This ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: MIDF Research expects a positive outlook for the property sector, citing strong underlying demand.

In a recent note, the firm said that property developers are likely to see earnings growth in the upcoming second quarter of 2024 (2QCY24).

"This is on the back of higher recognition from property projects as labour shortage issues are resolved while earnings outlook is also supported by improving new property sales," it said.

MIDF Research noted its top picks for the sector are Mah Sing Group Bhd and Mat

title: CPO futures expected to trade with downside bias next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with a downside bias next week, with prices anticipated to range between RM3,650 and RM3,850 per tonne, according to a trader.Palm oil ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with a downside bias next week, with prices anticipated to range between RM3,650 and RM3,850 per tonne, according to a trader.

Palm oil trader David Ng told Bernama that concerns over rising production and sluggish export pace are influencing this outlook.

A news report said that palm oil inventories in Malaysia were expected to decline in July for the first time after three consecutive months of increase.

title: Bursa Malaysia to trade range-bound with upside bias next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade range-bound with an upside bias next week as investors are believed to be ready to buy the breakout stocks to add to their positions or use leveraged tools to maximise profits, a ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade range-bound with an upside bias next week as investors are believed to be ready to buy the breakout stocks to add to their positions or use leveraged tools to maximise profits, a dealer said. 

 Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said the FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI) has shown four days of white candles, indicating momentum that could push the index towards the next resistance at 1,610.

title: Ringgit likely to continue uptrend next week, eyes on GDP print
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to continue its uptrend against the US dollar next week on the back of positive sentiment ahead of the release of macroeconomic data, an analyst said.Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to continue its uptrend against the US dollar next week on the back of positive sentiment ahead of the release of macroeconomic data, an analyst said.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid opined that investors' focus will be on Malaysia's gross domestic product (GDP) data for the second quarter (2Q) of 2024 due next Friday.

Apart from that, he said the United States (US) consumer price index (CPI) for July due on Wednesday will also be th

title: Sustainable construction: The next level
summary: On July 31, The Edge Malaysia and YTL Cement's Sustainable Construction: The Next Level Symposium was held at the JW Marriott Hotel Kuala Lumpur, where industry players came together to share knowledge and provide solutions to accelerate the industry’s growth towards sustainability.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 11): On July 31, The Edge Malaysia and YTL Cement's Sustainable Construction: The Next Level Symposium was held at the JW Marriott Hotel Kuala Lumpur, where industry players came together to share knowledge and provide solutions to accelerate the industry’s growth towards sustainability.

The by-invitation only event featuring the theme "Sustainable Construction Tomorrow: Milestones & Opportunities" was attended by over 300 industry stakeholders, including C-suites and directors of

title: CPI Land spreads wings, eyes larger scale projects
summary: This September, boutique developer CPI Land Sdn Bhd will be launching its third chapter of its Tuan series called Tuan Heritag3 Residency along Jalan Segambut, Kuala Lumpur. The project has a gross development value (GDV) of RM670 million. It offers 1,269 serviced apartments across a 45-storey, single-block development with unit built-ups ranging from 820 to 1,026 sq ft.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 11): This September, boutique developer CPI Land Sdn Bhd will be launching its third chapter of its Tuan series called Tuan Heritag3 Residency along Jalan Segambut, Kuala Lumpur. The project has a gross development value (GDV) of RM670 million. It offers 1,269 serviced apartments across a 45-storey, single-block development with unit built-ups ranging from 820 to 1,026 sq ft.

While it is the only new launch this year, the developer, which is in its expansion mode, is planning to roll out proj

title: Crisis + compassion
summary: Steering a global humanitarian and relief organisation like World Vision International is a formidable task that demands resilience, strategic foresight and an unwavering commitment to human welfare.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 11): Steering a global humanitarian and relief organisation like World Vision International is a formidable task that demands resilience, strategic foresight and an unwavering commitment to human welfare.

“Society is changing dramatically. It’s incredible. This year, 80% of the world’s population will vote for new leaders. Given these shifts, it is crucial that we understand global needs. We are really blessed to work in 100 countries worldwide, and we ensure our relevance by staying close to

title: Publishing pictures of children in criminal proceedings breaches Child Act — Azalina
summary: The public is reminded not to publish any pictures of children involved in criminal proceedings in the media, said Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (JPM) (Legal and Institutional Reform) Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Aug 10): The public is reminded not to publish any pictures of children involved in criminal proceedings in the media, said Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (JPM) (Legal and Institutional Reform) Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said.

In a post on her official Facebook, Azalina said the act violated Subsection 15(2) of the Child Act 2001 which could result in criminal charges.

"Referring to the recent cases involving children in criminal proceedin
